website_summaries.verdict: Riders looking for richer music quality from their headset can find it with Cardo’s updated communication system.
pros: Users hear intercom chatter clearly and music sounds great (as long as unit is positioned correctly in the helmet)
With the most recent update, voice controls are much easier to use
cons: Charging port’s position makes it vulnerable to damage

customer_reviews.title: Great Product With One Serious Flaw
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and pretty much does everything it says it will do, but it has one troubling weak point. On a long and windy trip all three of our packtalks developed cracks in the antennae and one completely snapped with the antennae hanging on by wires. I called and Cardo does not sell replacement antennae, but will cover it under warranty. Given that all three are having the same problem, I'd have to say that this will be a real weakness if you intend to use this product extensively. The warranty coverage is good, but doesn't help much when you're traveling everyday and can't get a replacement til you get home.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Cardo has the worst customer support I've ever seen in the motorcycle industry. They have no options for damaged items except to pay full price for a replacement unit. My headset was damaged in a crash, the outer case was cracked. The unit works fine, it just needs a new case. Cardo refused to either send me a new case or have me send it in for repair. I will never do business with this company again. I've owned many Sena headsets and have had no problems with them. I'll likely buy Sena when this unit fails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great intercom function, pairing not always smooth music skips regularly
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting this for intercom with other riders it works awesome. Took a bit to get everyone paired but once paired you can drop in and out without repairing. Definitely get the JBL speaker version. Tested with 5 riders works great, but range seems low when using the DMC connection that we use. I also have a problem where music will cut in and out, which happens to one of the other 6 units we've tested for 4/6 working properly. Update - two weeks in and the unit won't charge and is an expensive paperweight. Contacted support which states up to three business days before hearing back. This is becoming a very expensive headache.
customer_reviews.author: devin honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: PackTalk Just Blew Me Away
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Scala PackTalk to replace my old Scala G9. Super fast shipping. I alway liked my G9's but the PackTalk just blows them away. Easy install, sleek design and very well thought out system. Paired easily to my Motorcycle's GPS, My iPod and the sound is great the speakers do a really good job. Very Happy Happy Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hoang

customer_reviews.title: If you already have a JBL 40mm this is not an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I already have the new Cardo Slim version with the 40mm version of this. I bought this because I thought this would improve the quality and volume of the sound, while in reality it actually sounds the same or lower. I even tried measuring with a DB meter and there is no difference. The advertisement should be fixed to explain that. I cannot evaluate how different this would be for non-JBL versions.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for Packtalk JBL Bold replacement.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers do not work as well as the JBL Bold speakers I got with the Packtalk Bold system. In my second helmet, couldn't hear my intercom group hardly at all with these. Replaced them with an extra set of the JBL Bold speakers, and at the same volume level, nearly blew my ears out!
customer_reviews.author: Rick W

customer_reviews.title: Shipped wrong product
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this for my boyfriend for his birthday. When he opened it, there was only one scale rider. I purchased the dual pack, so him and I would be able to communicate. All excited for a let down of error in shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Jaranowski

customer_reviews.title: This product does not compare with the Skala G9
customer_reviews.text: My G9 from Cardo had worked flawlessly for six years. Battery life was failing. I Purchased the new Cardo product because of an excellent past experience. I was very disappointed. Within three hours of our two week trip into California there was horrible cracking noises on one headset. Found a boom mic they had shorted wires internally . Called Cardo and they would not even process a part if I paid for it for 48 hours. When someone talked you could hear a noticeable hiss until they finish talking and hiss would go away. Sound quality with the JBL speakers Was not as good as my G9’s. Battery life and range was good. I was disappointed with the manufacture support.
customer_reviews.author: john forsberg

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to be able to listen to music AND talk
customer_reviews.text: We came from the Scala G9, and I find this to be slightly easier to use -- fewer buttons to keep in mind, but at the same time, there are more things you can do with each button or combinations of buttons. Have to keep the instructions out for a bit until you learn your most common commands. We both stream music on one of the bluetooth connections, and then use DMC to talk to each other. We've had no issues with either unit.
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Defective- long process to get replacement through Cardo
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these. Updated firmware when received. Tried using both units, and one is defective. none of the amazing key features worked. Called Cardo, provided proof of purchase and described problem. After several days of waiting response w return directions (still waiting), they said they'll send instruction how to send back (postage paid by me), once received, they will send replacement... Should have just returned to Amazon or found different option. Lesson learned- any issues, return to Amazon immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Frank F.

customer_reviews.title: Love it...nothing to think about, just get it
customer_reviews.text: An awesome product for half helmets. At 70-80 mph I can hold a conversation on the phone without the other person even hearing road noise. I love it. I also have the full face “in helmet” system. This seems to work even better than the full face version.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Always thought the stock speakers that came with my Sena 20s were absolute garbage. Zero bass tinny to the point of being painful to my ears. Happened upon these on Amazon the other day and just installed them (helmet on and tunes blasting as I type this). They are WAY BETTER than the stock speakers. They have decent bass for their size and the sound is fantastic. Every now and then you buy something that is everything you hoped it would be. These are it. I am so happy to have decent sound in my helmet. If you are looking for a replacement for the Sena speakers, these are it. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cleland

customer_reviews.title: Cardo Pack Talk outshines Sena
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY pleased with the Cardo PackTalk Bold. I used a sena 20S for several years and was always disappointed in the Sena sound quality (lack of music volume). The Cardo Pack Talk Bold has NO ISSUES like that. The sound is crystal clear even at high speeds. The voice recognition is excellent. Noise cancelling microphone is excellent even with my open face helmet. I HIGHLY recommend the Cardo over the Sena. Now we must get Cardo and Sena mesh systems to communicate with each other. Get together kids and play nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford C Entringer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of garbage. First I had to cut into my new helmet for this to fit. Then when i get on the road it randomly dials people. I cant hear anything on the road if i am lucky to get pandora to play. Whenever my phone moves in my pocket there is alot of static when playing pandora. The fm radio is a joke. Good luck finding a station while riding. It will just keep saying the station name even is the station is complete static. Voice commands do not work while riding I expected more for something so expensive. I do not recomend this product. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: John and Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers on the market
customer_reviews.text: I think I finally found a fully functional helmet entertainment and communication system. I have used several over the years and the Cardo DMC puts all the others to shame. I use a full face helmet, and even at speed, I can clearly hear the music and communicate clearly. Installation requires a little time, and the directions leave something to be desired, but fits well once installed. I had to return my original purchase, for some reason the micro USB plug was missing, otherwise the second one had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t get this to pair with my iPhone XS Max. I performed the software update on the hardware and despite other reviews I’ve read about this fixing the issue, still had no luck. It may be that I just got a bad unit, but for the price paid I wasn’t willing to waste my time on a replacement unit. Sadly disappointed as I truly had high hopes for this.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Foss

customer_reviews.title: Needs updating and redesigned.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard good things about Cardo from a riding buddy. The Pactalk Bold installation took some time. It really wants to be glued to the helmet. So glad I didn’t do that! The Cardo Pactalk Bold is way worse than the Sena 50s. The build quality isn’t any better. In some ways it’s worse. I’m returning based on the likelihood of loosing it (see video). My gripes from a short use. The speakers are thick and not as clear sounding as the Sena 50s. The buttons are tiny and harder to use with gloves. The charging port is hard to access. I do like the Cardo boom mic design.
customer_reviews.author: ATX Man

customer_reviews.title: Best headset for helmet I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Great headset to install in a motorcycle helmet. I love everything about this unit. Great sound quality, great battery life, great communication signal with my friends that have them, easy to use. Noise cancellation works fairly well but that all depends on the quality of the helmet you install it in. Its a little more pricy that some similar units but its worth it if you can afford it. Five starts.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Nasbitt

customer_reviews.title: Good but only for a cardo product
customer_reviews.text: These definitely sounds good, decent bass fire the size. Problem is that they don't with so well for a sena product. I have a sena 20s and for whatever reason these are not as loud and clear as the stock Sena speakers. Maybe it's because Sena speakers have a proprietary plug and these are a standard 3.5 tire plug? I don't know but I know that with stock speakers in my helmet, with earplugs in, I have to turn down the volume. With these JBL installed even max volume was too low. Summary, if you have a freecom it other cardo unit these are great. Sena...not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Kingston73

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound,but cuts out occasionallylasted 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Jbl sould quality is excellent.phone call quality w/noise cancellation excellent.would prefer more mounting options like sticking on side of helmet.shoei neotec is tough to mount on.listening to music w/Bluetooth cuts out occasionally.update:3 months old the charge plug broke on unit.have to send for repair.crap.i should have kept riding around listening to the voices in my head saying keep your money in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: David s.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Sena 30x. I wish I hadn't. 1st.......I had to take a die grinder to the inner shell of the helmet. The speakers are so thick they stick out and press my ear. Until it hurts. 2nd...... For the being that big the sound is BAD. At highway speed,with a full face helmet and full windshield. The sound and barely be heard. 3rd........the voice activate part doesnt work on mine. 4th.......radio cuts in and out 5th......no safety line 6th.......the boom mic has a yellow arrow that has to face mouth. It's doesnt really rotate. So I have to try and rotate it every 20min so arrow faces mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Voice commands are great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit, I wish it was a bit cheaper though. There is a lot of technology built in so maybe the price is justified. The voice commands are great, I don't have to take a hand off the handlebars to do almost anything. Sound quality is pretty good, there is a lot of bass but I think it's pretty balanced too. Volume is loud enough, I use acoustic ear plugs when riding and can still hear the audio. When I first got the unit it was pretty buggy, but most of the problems seem to have been patched. The firmware upgrade software is really easy to use. So far with all the new patches everything is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great value for all the features
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Packtalk Duo which included two devices for me and my passenger. Setup and installation was easy and the wife and I started communicating right away In our helmets. It took a few times reading the manual to understand operations while in use such as switching from music library on my phone to radio And making calls. The voice interface isn’t as s, Moothas I’d like but still learning how to use it. Manual controls are more effective. Sound quality is great. Noise is very tame and People can’t tell I’m riding the bike.
customer_reviews.author: TimP

customer_reviews.title: Cool Technology
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this for wingsuiting/skydiving instead of motorcycles. It's cool technology to listen to music easily in the helmet but to also talk over the hum of airplane. Then while flying its good for quick communication. It's amazing that background and wind noise are filtered out. It's quick and easy to set up groups as needed. If you do get too far it reconnects easily. My only criticism is the supplied speakers are not great for skydiving but that's understandable. I just wish it allowed for a set of bluetooth headphones instead of wired. That would make for less wires in the helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: works really well
customer_reviews.text: nice to listen to music with ear plugs in and actully hear my music and not the wind noise. controls are easy to find with gloves on there are a lot of features so spend the time and learn them for your safety and your enjoyment. love i can talk on the phone and ride only thing for those than complain. i tested the first day with 6 people on 6 different phones and ear pieces. they all sounded different but said i sounded fine, so we made it pretty clear that what they are talking to you on determines how loud they sound its not a broken headset its THEIR phone
customer_reviews.author: Q. Jones

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: My third set of speakers for my Cardo Q3, I really had high hopes with the JBL branding that the speakers would be superior to the stock ones. They are probably OK for somebody riding slower and around town over short distances. Within the first couple of weeks mine were already blown and staticy at higher volume. Returned and trying my luck with the much more pricey IASUS XSound 3’s next 120 mile commute daily on multiple bikes, so definitely need the speaker quality 🤞🏼
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a awesome $300 paper weight...
customer_reviews.text: Constant issues with this pairing it up with the phone pairing it up with the app constantly having issues ,with one of the units not working correctly doesn’t follow volume settings ,you set the volume controls and it has one headset that doesn’t work correct... Customer service just keeps telling me to get the latest update.. done it time and time again do a “ hard reset” it’s kinda hard to hard reset while on the on the bike . For the price of this paired headset unit it should at least work out of the box disappointing😞
customer_reviews.author: giacomo

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I own a wide variety of headphones, and was excited to add a “premium sound” device to my motorcycle helmet..... These sound VERY bad. At about 70% volume (which is comparative to 40% on most over ear headphones), I started to hear distortion on the vocals. The bass is also nonexistent, it’s not bad, it just isn’t there, so most hip hop sound like they are missing heart. Buying a $40 old pair of broken beats is a better investment. These should not cost more than $30.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Love this communicator.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product i even purchased one for the wife. Makes riding better since you listen to music and are able to communicate with you other riders just have to pair up. The range on these is incredible. The speakers that come with it are not the best and at higher velocity its hard to make out what people are saying on coms and calls. Goot thing you are able to use earbuds if you would like. I like this unit because it also has Fm radio.
customer_reviews.author: Maximo

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Update Feb 4, 2019: The controls take a little getting used to and not easy to use with gloves on, but overall easy communication while riding has been a game changer. Original Review: I purchased the Cardo Packtalk communication devices for use with our snowmobile helmets. It took a while to determine the best way to install them, however it was very easy and there were no issues. I had trouble linking them initially, but a firmware update seems to have solved the problem. Sound quality seems exceptional!
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Good product just be carefull with USB plug
customer_reviews.text: First set I ordered, I plugged in the USB charger and when I pulled it out of both headsets the USB port pulled completely out of one and pulled out enough on the other that it had a short. I pulled the USB out just like I have on my Samsung phone many times and never had a problem. Good unit but you really must pull very gently and straight going very slowly. I would not recommend charging while riding as you may snage the cord and pull out the port
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device !!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Sena and an Ncom prior to switching to the Cardo Packtalk Bold. It is night and day compared to those units. The sound quality is much better as is the ease of use. I love the voice commands, which means no more fiddling around with buttons. It also solved my issue with listening to my iPhone music and getting voice commands from my GPS. I highly recommend it if you are frustrated with your old unit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Microphone and Audio Problems
customer_reviews.text: I had a few problems with this item so I returned it after using it on only three rides. The microphone shorted out or lost the connection intermittently so guys couldn't hear me during intercom conversations. (The mic wiring looks kinda flimsy.) Also, occasionally the BT audio had a "squeaky" noise that required me to unpair and then re-pair the audio (music) source. When the PackTalk worked properly, I liked it. But, I didn't like the lack of reliability. I may buy another one to see if a replacement device works 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: T W

customer_reviews.title: The USB charging port breaks off easily.
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced one of my units because the USB charging port broke off inside the unit. It uses the USB micro port which doesn't stand up to long term use but the port on the Cardo Palk Talk slim eventually breaks off completely inside the unit. I was always very careful with mine but now my other unit also has a broken USB charging port. A redesign is need to resolve this issue. The port should be changed to a USB C and be better supported by the housing. I like the functionality and still prefer Cardo over the Sena but I don't want to have to replace them every two years because of a deign defeat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Taylor

customer_reviews.title: First BT Units
customer_reviews.text: These are our first BT units having been corded on HD or Honda's prior. Other than it being a PITB to sync with my SENA SR10-10 unit I love these things. Super long Battery life, great sound quality, I have my GPS, MUSIC, CB and COMM with WIFE all at same time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: The speakers I got are awful.
customer_reviews.text: While the speakers say JBL they don’t appear to be the upgraded ones. The sound quality is worse than what I would expect from a $5set of headphones. Maybe they are defective. Not execrable quality at all. It’s still new so I’m still playing with it trying to learn the controls. Wondering what the upgraded speakers would sound like for another $90 or if I should trust a company that would put there name on the garbage I received.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: A really great item.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the Scala Cardo Q3 model but wanted to upgrade. Though pricey, the sound quality and group communication abilities are superior to the Q3. Takes some study of the manual but the results are worth the price. The ability to hear the radio in the background when talking to others is a fantastic technological feat. Gets easier to use with practice. I recommend this product even if you have older Cardo products.
customer_reviews.author: Art Edelstein

customer_reviews.title: Leaps and bounds better sound than my old cardo Q2 pro
customer_reviews.text: So far loving my packtalk bold! Excellent sound quality mounted on my sheoi gt air. Works great with my Zumo 395 and 396 and my old Moto G6 and new G stylus. Hey cardo and okay Google commands have worked great. Phone calls are excellent, most have no idea I'm on my bike. Others that know I ride say they can faintly hear my exhaust if I'm under acceleration, otherwise they say it's as if I'm just on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: R. March

customer_reviews.title: Great item for every rider!
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very simple. It did take a bit of work with my Bilt Force One helmet, but was well worth it. Now I can cruise while listening to my tunes and chat with my group. I did compare with my friends non JBL unit. There doesn't seem to be much difference in sound quality. If all you can afford is the cheaper unit...go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Much better for music while riding!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality carries the JBL reputation well! One thing to consider is the size. These are larger than the speakers that come with the Packtalk Bold, unsure about other models. The standard speakers fit my helmet well, a Scorpion EXO AT-950 without issue. With these larger JBL speakers, I can slightly feel them inside the helmet. My helmet isn't tight, or overly snug, so this is not an issue for me and the comfort is not changed. However, the audio quality is much better and I am enjoying listening to music on the motorcycle!
customer_reviews.author: Ron C

customer_reviews.title: Great. Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I put the Cardo PACKTALK BOLD on my Bilt Evolution Modular helmet which has speaker pockets. I did not use the pads to make the speakers stick out more from the sides of the helmet. I did slit the rubber on the helmet bottom so I could use the slide-on mount. I paired it with my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge phone. I can play music, intercom with passenger, and play FM radio (which was easy to tune.) I sync'd it to my passenger's Cardo FREECOM 1 PLUS headset. He pushes the front button to start intercom. I push the top button for that function. I used the boom mic.
customer_reviews.author: I Buy A Lot From Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to my Sena SMH-10
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the SMH-10 for years and found it adequate. However, my passenger has always had difficulty in hearing me at highway speeds. I took a gamble on the Cardo unit and the performance is much better than the Sena. She can hear and understand me clearly, which is primarily the reason I got it. It turns out that the unit has a few other tricks up its sleeve as well. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Maximo

customer_reviews.title: Ordered SLIM recieved BOLD twice!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product twice now with the description of SLIM, but have recieved the BOLD. I finally cancelled the order completely and am currently trying to re-order the SLIM in hopes it fixes the issue. Once I recieve the actual item I want I will update my review. Until then, no can do.
customer_reviews.author: Sigrid

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: This our first foray into helmet intercoms. Installation is fairly easy, setup is a breeze. We are currently using them with open faced biltwell helmets but also switch them to our full faced helmets. Without a face shield, when talking there is some crackling and interference, with a face shield or full face helmet, they function flawlessly. They sound quality Is great, ease of use likewise, great, voice commands work as advertised. A really, we are satisfied that we made the right decision going with the Cardo packtalk bold. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds better but...
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is definitely better than the original speakers that came with the Packtalk but I haven’t noticed any difference in volume which is the reason I purchased these. I’m outside of the return period so I have to keep them. Knowing what I know now I would’ve just stayed with the original set. The sound quality was good enough for me before. I just wanted more volume.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is horrible. I can hear music , and voice command only works once a day , I factory reset , upgraded firmware , went on YouTube , and still nothing back from this company. I am not able to enjoy a product I spent over 200 dollars on
customer_reviews.author: JOR-EL & CUBBY EL

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price tag but nice if you take advantage of all the features
customer_reviews.text: Side note: I bought brand new and it came used. I could tell from the finger prints all over the unit and the misplaced items inside the box Product review: The JBL speakers do not hold up that well when you going on the motorcycle. The sound of the bike really tones down the volume unless you have the speakers directly on your ears. You should be able to make them louder. I started using my airpods and they are way better.
customer_reviews.author: The-Boss

customer_reviews.title: Good range. I'm still playing with the Smarset app
customer_reviews.text: Basic features work well. No problem syncing with my phone and gps. Clear communications with paired headset, phone and gps. Good range. I'm still playing with the Smarset app. Disappointed that it doesn't pair with some older Cardo Bluetooth units. I thought it would and that was one of the reasons I bought it. Voice commands are terrible at best. The unit is always trying to turn music on. Battery life is very good. Its a lot of money for a unit that doesn't wow me. I have owned Cardo units for several years without any issues, new technology may not be better.
customer_reviews.author: R. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Product! My Wife & I love this comma system. Make sure When you get it, to watch Motogeek Freak's youtube demo videos it will give you a visual on how to properly operate it. Just run with DMC mode all the time and you'll be amazed. Don't get the Tork XPro speakers they don't work well with this system. We use our Bose Earbuds it's the best sound, very loud & clear, we took out all the helmet speakers and just use the ear buds the speakers weren't loud enough. Once you understand how to operate it, the system works very very well. I totally recommend it. ENJOY! ALOHA Nui
customer_reviews.author: Luis Felix

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: I picked these out as a gift for my dad who loves to snowmobile. We tried them out while on a trip and they are amazing! You can listen to music and talk to someone at the same time! Beware - it took awhile to set them up, and I used some online videos since the manual is a little dense. However, once we had set them up once, they turn on and connect each time. They have a pretty good range and can even be heard over the loud hum of the sleds! Must have for people who snowmobile in groups!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Ahern

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on a Neotec 2
customer_reviews.text: The headset works great, sounds clear, and the battery rarely requires charging with my use. Pairs with one of my cheap $50 headsets no problem. Mounted mine on a Shoei Neotec 2 so while it isn't a "perfect" fit since the helmet is designed for a Sena unit I was still able to get it on just fine and being able to use voice commands helps a ton with not having to fumble around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodo

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset with 1 major flaw
customer_reviews.text: I loved the pactalk slim. Audio is clear, sound is loud with JBL speakers, and I love that i can still listen to my own music while in DMC intercom mode (my buddies with Sena S10s can’t do that). The one glaring flaw is that the entire charging port pulled out of the headset, rendering it useless! A group of us bought 5 in total and 3 of the 5 had the same issue. I contacted Cardo and they sent me another headset as mine was only 1 week old but for that reason alone, I can only give it 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Update first, learn later
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality and battery life. Turn off the adaptive sound control for best results. People on the other end of a phone call can't tell I'm on the bike, granted, I'm behind a windshield, but have a noisy helmet. I'm taking a star off because as soon as you learn how to use it, if you plug it in to update the firmware they've changed button functions and remove some features (little things like fm scanning and stuff like that.) the app is fantastic, which has also changed. Do yourself a favor and update it right out of the box. No touchy. Just update.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Charging connection failure. Voice command sux.
customer_reviews.text: The charging slot pushed into the devise rendering it useless. Sound quality was good but it was hard for others to hear me in my full faced Shoei helmet while on a phone call. Voice commands are virtually useless as well. To bad it didnt live up to the hype because the promise was way more than the delivery. I'm bummed about its lack of performance. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: usb charging port
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the packtalk slim for 4 months. in this time I have used and charged it about 8 times where I plug in the charger. I went to plug in my pillions unit and it felt like I wasn't in all the way and the charge light did not light, so I pulled the usb charger out to try again and was greeted with the guts of the usb port on my charging cable. Very very disappointed in a system that cost $500. now lets see how their warranty is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: Thought if would be better the money, not a great fit for the Bell SRT modular. Boom mix does stay hooked, the corded mic is short for the modular helmet. the speakers doesn't stay in place. Did have a question and the manufacture responded quickly - asked if the had a way to extend the corded mic. No we don't make any thing like that- short and sweet. End of discussion. If I find a way to extend it - I'll try to update.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !
customer_reviews.text: Installed on Simpson ghost bandit helmet . Called a few people while I was riding and they had no idea . Music is loud thanks to JBL . Very happy with it .scary how good the speakers are can barely hear the Motor (Harley with pipes)
customer_reviews.author: michael s.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Easy operation. Voice Command only works some of the time. Hand controls are well laid out. I haven't had time to road test it yet. I'll update the review when I do. Update: Attempted to update firmware with another USB cable I had, same fitting, and it won't show the unit is connected to my computer. Is the Cardo USB Cable required? If so, why didn't I get one in the box? I'm hoping the seller can resolve this. If they do, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Not really sure.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers might be perfect on a cardo unit. I found these to be no better than the stock sena 30k speakers when hooked to a 30k. They might be far better speakers than the 30k speakers and the 30k might now be powering them properly which is my guess. So if you have a 30k and are looking for a speaker upgrade this isn't it imo.
customer_reviews.author: C-KicksXL

customer_reviews.title: Works Well with our Helmets
customer_reviews.text: These work well with our helmets, one fits in a port and the other we installed on the side with the adhesive. The sound quality is good, but for the passenger a lot of wind noise is picked up in the mic. For a single driver listening to music it's really nice and at low speeds it's nice to be able to talk with the passenger. The installation was fairly easy, getting the pads back in the helmet was harder than placing everything for this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good sound. Google girl has a hard time hearing me.
customer_reviews.text: Install was only a bit difficult, in a Shoei RF-1200. The speakers hit my ears, so I have to manipulate the helmet some to get my ears to settle. The volume roller is easy to adjust while riding. While searching for the buttons, if i stroke the surface between the buttons, volume increases. This is not a function listed in the manual. Weird....
customer_reviews.author: P&K S

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been on the hunt for a quality set of speakers for my cardo scala q3 for awhile now. These definitely fit the bill! They sound great - 100x better than the cardo brand speaker upgrades. The bass is existent, the highs and mids are clean and clear, and they can get loud. The only reason I’m not giving them 5 stars is because the software upgrade isn’t compatible with the scala q3. If the software was compatible, I’d definitely rate them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hijinx1812

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product so I could talk with my friends when we all go riding together or if I want to listen to music. Or if my wife calls while I'm riding I can answer! Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth communicator ever!
customer_reviews.text: Omg where do I start. Installation was a breeze, but speaker placement took a while. Once they were right over my ears (nowhere near the speaker pocket in the helmet) the bass, the clarity, and the sound. Absolutely amazing. The JBL speakers are incredible. Haven’t been able to pair with my sons Sena but we’ll figure it out. The app is ok. Kinda boring but gets the job done. Pairs with my iPhone fine. Haven’t used for a phone call yet but we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Jgraham

customer_reviews.title: Best option on market as of 2020.
customer_reviews.text: Having tried the alternatives, I confidently tell you this is the best value you’ll find. Sena units have terrible connectivity, no usable voice controls, poor sound quality, and are not waterproof at all. This unit solves those issues, but I feel certain there is still room for improvement in a few areas. Buy knowing it’s the best option on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Greif

customer_reviews.title: Great headset!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset for my wife and myself to be able to talk to each other while she is riding with me. It's great to listen to music. The sound could be a little higher. Phone works great, for the most part. Again, sometimes it's kind of hard to hear. Overall, I'm very pleased with this headset.
customer_reviews.author: goose1063

customer_reviews.title: Provides no tangible upgrade to present set-up
customer_reviews.text: There was no discernible difference in sound quality compared to the stock SENA 20C speakers. In fact, the SENA’s were actually louder than the Cardo’s. This may simply be a compatibility gap, however this product was hyped as working with most speaker systems. They did a very good job in marketing this product, unfortunately the result is underwhelming. I returned this product, and will maintain the SENA stock speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Ogi

customer_reviews.title: 2 helmets this is what you need.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 helmets and this is what was needed to be able to just connect the main unit and start using. I absolutely love this. Will buy more as my helmet collection grows.
customer_reviews.author: Maximo

customer_reviews.title: This system was a game changer! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This communication system has brought our biking trips to a whole new level. I wish we would have purchased one sooner. It is great to be able to have conversation with my husband while riding. We get many hours and have not run out of battery life yet. Don't hesitate to spend the money. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected without issue
customer_reviews.text: love this thing, only complaint is on the mount for the battery it scratches the back on my head taking off my helmet. Works perfect for my other helmets though. Noise canceling is really well done, the voice works once you remember what to say. The sound quality is exceptional and adjusts to speed or other sound. The mesh connection with other riders is the best option, paired and connected without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: These work Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This cardo unit worked great in my rf1100, then I moved it over to my new HJC rhpa 11 pro and the speakers hurt my ears. I let the helmet break in for a couple of months and swapped them back in and they finally don't hurt my ears! The HJC is slightly slimmer due to the race profile. Life changer to have music!
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: While it took a little effort to get it into my Shoei, it has proven to be well worth it. I am not impressed (at all) by the Cardo App, it has not mattered to me since Siri and Alexa both respond. Great connectivity and have even had phone conversations where the other party had no idea I was on my bike. Sound is phenomenal and works great with google maps as well. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet intercom - setup is easy - no audio problems
customer_reviews.text: I'm a helmet intercom newbie - used this system on an 8 hour ride - everything worked great, was easy to setup, and the battery life was amazing! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Overall the best bluetooth motorcycle headset on the market
customer_reviews.text: Wish these were cheaper and speakers could still be better. Other than that I think these are the best units on the market.
customer_reviews.author: AverageWhiteMan

customer_reviews.title: Best unit so far
customer_reviews.text: We have the duo .We love the mesh intercom we ride separate bikes.only thing complaint is if I sing or talk to yourself to music it activates intercom Would be nice if you turn mike on and off. Sound is good but you must really play with speaker location. I had to cut up ear pieces on my half helmet to get speakers in right position.Also bought the boom mike cradle, which turned out to be a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Could not get one unit to work , comes with 2mics per unit tried all of them on 2nd unit couldn’t get them to work . Major dissatisfaction a lot of $$ . For the amount of money these units should be superb . I would look else where if you are looking for something that works . One chance to make a first impression and they failed miserably. Returned with no problem. Amazon is a great place as far as returns and customer support .
customer_reviews.author: Timothy lambert

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Had all my friends buy these. Dirt biking has never been more fun. You can talk at a normal voice level and all the outside noise is cancelled. These are amazing. Great for when you have a ton of kids following you but even more amazing when your riding with your buddies.
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I switch from a sena slim to this bulky cardo pack and it was worth it. the sound quality is awesome with the jbl speakers, most of the time im on the phone most people don't even know I'm riding. Then being able to listen to music and talk with my buddies when we ride together is badass. Overall I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Initially had issues with Packtalk Bold. Still have issues mints later so I changed this review. Now when using command Cardo, music on. It replies back music off every time but plays music. Not happy with the functionality of the product after getting to use it. I bought it for the JBL speakers. But they are not any better than the other head sets I have.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy connect,  very good battery life , Great sound quality , Awesome  noise cancelation,
customer_reviews.text: Great product, usually rides in group of 6-8, all Cardo packtalk, easy to connect, noise cancellation works perfect, the battery last all day for me 8-10 hrs of ride, music sound is great, we all switched from Sena 30K to Cardo Packtalk & are very happy with the switch, we’ll worthy,
customer_reviews.author: MikeC

customer_reviews.title: Enhanced the riding experience
customer_reviews.text: Great system. Undertook 4 solid days of riding and this type of system adds a lot to the experience. Only two of us had it - I'm not sure 15 concurrent users would be workable in a single conversation but knowing we can scale up to that many was a good buying point. The system worked well and range was good. We were out on very flat roads so it was a good test. I suspect we went to about 1,000 m while at highway speeds. Overall I think this is a really good product and well supported by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son love these. They work perfectly. They are looking forward to traveling together and being able to communicate with each other.
customer_reviews.author: bamc

customer_reviews.title: Uselessly quiet. Definitely not for motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: These are so quiet at max volume that they’re pointless. Even sitting on my couch with no earplugs and my helmet on, the max volume on these is what my normal listening volume would be if I was just walking and listening to something. Totally useless when you add in road noise.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Xmas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motorcycle communication device
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for the past year and a half and I like it. Just like any communication device the speaker quality for music is always an issue when on a motorcycle. You have to put a lot of time making sure the speakers are as close to your ears as possible without bothering you. This product is excellent for phone calls and talking to others, when you have someone else that has a set and rides with you. Only con I have it takes a lot of practice learning all the different features it has and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Cardoesn't
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked to give it a great review. Have contacted CARDO 4 time . They try to help, they recognize there is a problem, they haven't fixed the problem. They say we will contact you, first couple of times they returned the call or emailed. Since then we have heard nothing. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne & Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before I purchased them. They were easy to install. Have great battery life even in DMC. Range is exceptional. Would like a end call voice command, but that is minor. Had 1 issue usb port broke. Contacted cardo they immediately sent me a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound quality
customer_reviews.text: We rode 1x wrapped back up and returned and then purchased Sena. We spent all day trying to figure out what each other were saying. The sound was totally muffled. We got lost from each other in a parking lot and lost reception. Turned out we were only about 30-50 ft apart no buildings in the way. Extremely frustrating day of riding due to this intercom system. THANKFUL to Amazon who allowed us to return and get full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Pyle

customer_reviews.title: The only benefit is the boom mic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an LS2 half helmet, fitment is another issue, but the ONLY benefit for this item is the boom mic. For me, its actually too long. They need to make it somehow adjustable. They should also change the way you can clip the mount onto the helmet. It should rotate and lock...
customer_reviews.author: Paul Glickman

customer_reviews.title: L/R Audio out of phase from the unit.
customer_reviews.text: Left and Right audio are out of phase. Stereo-center and/or mono signal (vocals, navigation voice) is extremely quite at max volume while L/R panned information in music is loud. The problem is in the unit itself, not the Cardo earphones, because I tested with regular headphones into the Cardo 3.5mm jack and the issue is still present. If Cardo Support is responsive to my support ticket and replaces the faulty unit with a working one, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: M1

customer_reviews.title: A Huge Upgrade Over Other Brands
customer_reviews.text: Just installed these over the weekend, but very impressed so far. The sound is great, and the overall quality and design is above what I expected. I replaced a set of FreedCon intercoms, and it's a night and day difference. The controls are easy to navigate, even with gloves on. Also I love that we can listen to music or an audiobook while still talking, which will be great for long trips.
customer_reviews.author: Cochranes05

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. I bought these because they market that they use JBL speakers and I was looking for good sound quality. The problem is that everything sounds scratchy and distorted. The speakers are probably fine but the Bluetooth connection is garbage. I truly cannot speak for the battery life as I could not get undistorted sound so I removed them from my helmet after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W Langridge

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Great unit! I rode for few weeks now and use it almost everyday. What I like about the sound is that it automatically gets louder once you start riding, and quiets down once you slow down. Controls are very easy to use with gloves. Volume is very good, sometimes even too loud and I ride with Cobra slip-ons which are loud, so unit handles everything so well. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Justas

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement for Sena, need an equalizer
customer_reviews.text: These ear phone speakers were purchased to replace the Sena speakers and they are definitely louder but you have to use an equalizer with them or they will not sound right - I have an app that includes an equalizer for playing the music and in that way I can use these - they're definitely a lot louder than the Sena stock speakers. The high end is a little too bright and these speakers were meant for a different purpose... But with an equalizer they sound really good. They are a little thicker also than the Sena speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jd DaDude

customer_reviews.title: Serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well, and has good sound, however, the small USB port used to charge and update firmware is very fragile and will break under normal usage rendering the unit unusable. I have contacted Cardo for a replacement/advice.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Handy devices that work well.
customer_reviews.text: Range could be better when you only have two people which is why 4 stars, otherwise they are good. The company issues frequent firmware updates with new features which you will want to get for your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Makovette

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS, never buying a Sena again!
customer_reviews.text: voice control, JBL speakers. amazing device. ok I've had it for awhile now and never disappoints. ONLY this that id say is a draw back is when the volume is up all the way and you need it to hear your voice commands you need to roll back to volume down give command then roll the volume back up but sound quality is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F

customer_reviews.title: Cardo vs Sena
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a long time Sena user and the Cardo superior in Boise canceling and sound quality. Only downside is distance of connect. The Sena is better in this category.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing unit
customer_reviews.text: This thing does so much more than the other Cardo units I've owned. Love how easy it is to connect to other units and how I can run either my phone music, or local radio stations. We have 3 of these units and no problems with any of them. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Roach

customer_reviews.title: When it works...
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds quality, easy install. I have trouble with the voice commands being extremely spotty, sometimes they work, sometimes they dont. When it does pick up my voice it works well but "hey cardo" almost never works at all... hopefully it's just a software update that's needed....
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Mesh is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Love that it reconnects to any other rider in the mesh group quickly. Its gread that the riders dont have to keep riding in order. We can mix up who leads and who sweeps and stay connected. Range seems a little shorter than my old Cardo unit. Not measured, but it seemed to disconnect earlier in mountainous areas.
customer_reviews.author: Buster

product_meta.title: Cardo DMC/Bluetooth PACKTALK BOLD Motorcycle Communication and Entertainment System With Natural Voice Operation, Sound By JBL, Connect 2 to 15 Riders (Single Pack)
product_meta.description: With our natural voice operation feature Whether you ride with a buddy or in a group from 2 to 15, just say "hey Cardo", and your PACKTALK BOLD will do the rest. It even connects directly to Siri and Ok Google. 40mm-wide, high-definition speakers by JBL and specially-tuned audio processor deliver a sound experience like no other. DMC enables to connect with up to 15: Stay connected whether you are riding in duo, a group of four or a pack of fifteen. Enjoy the highest quality, long distance reception of Up to 1600 meters/1 Mile FM radio: Built-in FM Radio with RDS for automatic selection of the strongest signal Share your play list or favorite radio station with your passenger Charge while you ride: Just plug your unit to a battery pack or your 12V charger and use your unit while charging. Full remote-control ability and easy customization of settings with the Cardo Connect App for iOS android phones. Smart audio mixing: Sophisticated algorithms make sure that all your audio sources – FM radio, music, mobile calls and intercom work together in parallel. Universal connectivity: Connect your unit to any Bluetooth headset of any substantial brand. What's in the box: Pack Talk Bold, Pack Talk Bold audio kit, 40mm HD Speakers by JBL, Corded microphone, Hybrid microphone, Glue plate Freecom4+, Rectangular Velcro pads, Square Velcro, Speaker relocates (boosters), pads, USB cable
feature_bullets: Natural Voice - With our all-new, always-on, natural voice operation feature, you will never have to press a button, turn a wheel or move a slider again, because we have just empowered your voice.
Sound By JBL - Music and motorcycling are both great passions. Cardo-JBL partnership delivers – for the very first time – an ultimate listening experience
DMC - Dynamic Mesh Communication (DMC) solves all Bluetooth usual pains and turns PACKTALK BOLD into the most capable motorcycle communication system in the world.

General Features - Waterproof and Dustproof, Bluetooth 4. 1, Up to 13 hours talk time and up to 1. 6 km bike to bike range, Interchangeable boom and corded microphone options, Self-adjusting volume, Built-in FM radio. *To use with Half Helmets please purchase the FREECOM Half helmet kit

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars448 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
